Description: Neck and body sherd of small Clazomenian black-figured pottery neck-amphora with handle root; modelled ridge at junction of neck and shoulder; exterior: neck reserved; red on ridge; below, black-figure panel with komast dancing to left (face, most of right arm and both legs missing; hair in added red), left arm lowered; handle zone black, as remains of lower body.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a parallel regarding the dancer, compare British Museum 1888,0208.78a.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 87, pl. X, no. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.009) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
